segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, stretching to reach the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so close to falling, but he doesn’t seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and I’m worried he’ll hurt himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting patiently, but she’s just as guilty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they’re both going to get in trouble if the woman turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is making everything slippery—this is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe they’re so careless in their own kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is completely oblivious, and it’s frustrating to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t fall and break something—or himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just one big accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
